name: Country Music Trivia Again Quiz | Country Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: In George Strait's "Ocean Front Property", where does he say he has some ocean front property?
questions.explanation:
Arizona.

	The line is "I've got some ocean front property in Arizona and if you'll buy that I'll throw the Golden Gate in free".

questions.text: What is the alternate title to Brad Paisley's song, "I'm Gonna Miss Her"?  The __________ Song.
questions.explanation:
fishing&fishin'&fishin.

	This song tells the story of a man and wife where the wife threatens to leave him if he goes fishing and his response is "well I'm gonna miss her".

questions.text: What movie featured the song "Good Morning Beautiful" by Steve Holy?
questions.explanation:
Angel Eyes.

	"Angel Eyes" starred Jennifer Lopez and James Caviezel.

questions.text: What Led Zeppelin classic did Dolly Parton record for "Halos and Horns"?
questions.explanation:
Stairway to Heaven.

	A great Bluegrass album and a suprisingly decent version by Dolly on "Stairway to Heaven".

questions.text: What chart topper wrote "Bye Bye" and "I'm Alright" for Jo Dee Messina?
questions.explanation:
Phil Vasser.

	Phil Vasser also wrote "Postmarked Birmingham" for Blackhawk, "Little Red Rodeo" for Collin Raye, "For a Little While" for Tim McGraw, and "Right on the Money" for Alan Jackson.

questions.text: What city is the singer singing about when he sings about a recovering alcoholic selling VCR's at a Walmart?
questions.explanation:
Little Rock.

	Those lines are taken from Collin Raye's song "Little Rock".

questions.text: What was the title of The Dixie Chicks' first album released?
questions.explanation:
Thank Heavens for Dale Evans.

	The Dixie Chicks released their very first album in 1990 titled "Thank Heavens for Dale Evans". At that time the group was a quartet featuring Martie Siedel, Emily Erwin, Laura Lynch, and Robin Lynn Macy. Laura Lynch and Robin Lynn Macy were replaced later on with Natalie Maines, and that is when the Dixie Chicks took off and become one of the top selling artists in the country.

Joe Nichols.

	This song is Joe Nichols' first chart success. I think he sounds just like Clint Black.

questions.text: In the Blake Shelton song "Ol' Red", where is the prison that the character in the song is sent to?
questions.explanation:
Georgia.

	A great song about a guard dog that doesn't allow anyone to ever escape- but the character in the song comes up with a plan to get Ol' Red a female friend and when he tries to escape, instead of chasing after him, the dog goes off after the female dog. A great country song.

questions.text: Now for an old time Country Music question. The Billboard Country Music chart was first published in 1944. What song was the first number 1 hit?
options: They Took the Stars Out of Heaven
Stars and Stripes on Iwo Jima
questions.explanation:
Pistol Packin' Mama.

	"Pistol Packin' Mama" was that first number 1. It was recorded by Bing Crosby and the Andrews Sisters. The odd thing was that the second number 1 song was also "Pistol Packin' Mama", but this version was by Al Dexter.
